item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Intersection of Mount Pleasant & Gough Street, 2nd August
item.description:
There is ongoing construction works to the building 200 Gray’s Inn Road. At the back of the building on Gough Street, there construction erected generators and added sound proofing that blocks the entry to the car park. The car park is not only used by residents but is shared with the Royal Mail Group, so it’s a working office location that needs access Monday-Saturday at the minimum. The road is very narrow and the trucks from RMG cannot pass, which forces them to drive on the pavement to gain access to the car park. In addition the access continuously is blocked by trucks and other vehicles - either blocking the road completely or at a minimum leaving parked vans at the car park entry. When confronting staff at the construction site, they point that everyone goes on the pavement and we should do the same. This is not acceptable! The pavement is not made to withhold big vans and this will inevitably result in damage to the pavement which the construction site won’t be responsible for. Additionally, it’s not safe for vehicles to drive on the pavement, particularly because there is a primary school nearby. The construction site must find an alternative route to loading and other spaces to park their vehicles. I urge you to look into this matter and address this immediately as concerns raised directly with the construction manager have not resulted in any action in the past 3 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gough Street, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 7 green garden waste bags left overnight ripped open by foxes, 2nd August
item.description:

item.title: Tree roots caused pavement issues, 2nd August
item.description:
The tree behind our house at 6 Leydon Close has overgrown roots which have caused damage to the pavement making it dangerous to walk. These roots have also spread into our garden and causing cracks on our garden wall. This has been reported back in Oct 2024 - Enquiry 30557934 - and has been confirmed to be an issue post inspection by the Arboricultural team; but there has been no update ever since.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Leydon Close, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
